rules: Rule1: If the paper violates ethics guidelines, then the paper does not have ethical approval
Rule2: Either the paper focuses on a novel material or the paper focuses on an existing material
Rule3: If the paper focuses on an existing material, then the paper does not contain experimental data
Rule4: If the paper influences future studies, then the paper is cited by researchers
Rule5: If the paper triggers a plagiarism investigation, then the paper receives a formal complaint
Rule6: If the paper triggers a plagiarism investigation, then the paper is not found guilty of plagiarism
Rule7: Either the paper was submitted to Materials Science Quarterly journal or the paper was submitted to Advanced Materials Research journal
Rule8: If the paper receives a formal complaint, then the paper is found guilty of plagiarism
Rule9: If the paper was submitted to Advanced Materials Research journal, then either the paper has passed peer review or the paper undergoes editorial review
Rule10: If the paper contains experimental data, then the paper includes materials characterization
Rule11: Either the paper contains experimental data or the paper undergoes editorial review
Rule12: If the paper requires major revisions, then the paper is accepted for publication
Rule13: If the paper is accepted for publication, then the paper is published in Advanced Materials Research journal
Rule14: If the paper is accepted for publication, then the paper is not published in Materials Science Quarterly journal

Rule15: If it is not the case that publishing the paper in Advanced Materials Research journal leads to publishing the paper in Materials Science Quarterly journal, then the paper enters retraction process

Rule16: If it is not the case that publishing the paper in Advanced Materials Research journal leads to publishing the paper in Materials Science Quarterly journal, then the paper triggers a plagiarism investigation
Rule17: If it is not the case that the paper focusing on a novel material results in the paper not containing experimental data, then the paper influences future studies
Rule18: If it is not the case that the paper focusing on a novel material results in the paper not containing experimental data, then the paper is not cited by researchers

Rule19: If it is not the case that submitting the paper to Materials Science Quarterly journal leads to either the paper passing peer review or the paper undergoing editorial review, then the paper receives a desk rejection

Rule20: If it is not the case that submitting the paper to Materials Science Quarterly journal leads to either the paper passing peer review or the paper undergoing editorial review, then the paper does not receive a desk rejection
Rule21: If it is not the case that the paper not undergoing editorial review leads to the paper meeting initial screening criteria, then the paper has ethical approval
Rule22: If it is not the case that the paper not undergoing editorial review leads to the paper meeting initial screening criteria, then the paper violates ethics guidelines
Rule23: If the paper does not undergo editorial review, then the paper requires major revisions
facts: Fact1: The paper has not passed peer review
Fact2: The paper does not enter retraction process
Fact3: The paper does not meet initial screening criteria
Fact4: The paper does not include materials characterization
